data.sentence: The word لَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.
data.sentence: The word يَشْعُرُونَ comes from the root ش ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.

data.meanings: To practice deceit or guile or circumvention, practice evasion or elusion, to plot, to excercise art or craft or cunning, act with policy, practice strategem.
